To simplify the rational expression (2x^2 + 6x) / (4x^3 + 8x^2), first factor out the common factors in both the numerator and the denominator.

Numerator: 2x^2 + 6x = 2x(x + 3)
Denominator: 4x^3 + 8x^2 = 4x^2(x + 2)

Now the expression becomes:

(2x(x + 3)) / (4x^2(x + 2))

Next, cancel out the common factors:

(2x(x + 3)) / (4x^2(x + 2)) = (x + 3) / (2x(x + 2))

The simplified rational expression is:

(x + 3) / (2x(x + 2))
